column4: guys, how do you get a Logitech Headset to be useable in Ubuntu 11.04? Ubuntu recognizes it but it wont let me use it.
run 'alsamixer' in a terminal, look for muted channels, channels with really low volume, or anything related to line/capture/mic/output/input
hit TAB if you run out
where would the usb headset show up in alsamixer (first time using it)
sorry, is the audio meant to come in over USB, too?
yes.  its a mic and headphone headset.
with only a USB port input
this is usually corrected with a reboot if i leave the headset plugged in during the whole process
so something tells me some sort of "reset" on the audio in ubuntu would get it working
or notlistening, any idea on how to get my headset useable in ubuntu without rebooting the whole machine each time i want to use it?
you're probably losing a service or something to do with udev
when it's working or when it isn't?
its not working atm and when i "Test Speakers" it crashes the "Sound Preferences" dialog
how do i check to see if i have pulse?
you should I'm pretty sure it's still default in Ubuntu
